results.name: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n-1} 3^k*B(k)*C(n,k) where B(k) is the k-th Bernoulli number and C(n,k)=binomial(n,k).
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..510
G. Almkvist and A. Meurman, Values of Bernoulli polynomials and Hurwitz's Zeta function at rational points, C. R. Math. Rep. Acad. Sci. Canada 13 (1991), 104-109
B. Sury, The value of Bernoulli Polynomials at rational numbers, Bull. London Math. Soc. 25 (1993), 327-29.
formula: a(n) = 3^n * ( B(n,1/3) - B(n,0) ), where B(n,x) denotes the n-th Bernoulli polynomial. More generally, Almkvist and Meurman show that k^n * ( B(n, 1/k) - B(n, 0) ) is an integer sequence for k = 2,3,4,..., which proves the integrality of A083008 through A083014.
a(0) = 1 and for n >= 1, a(n) = 1 - 1/(n + 1)*Sum_{k = 1..n-1} 3^(n-k)*binomial(n+1,k)*a(k) (Sury, Section 1). (End)
